availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Ferdinand Wooldridge (Fulton County and Hickman County, KY, hotelkeeper and farmer )

body.p: Fulton County and Hickman County, Kentucky, hotelkeeper and farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Matilda Wooldridge. Father of Nancy K. Wooldridge, Amanda M. Wooldridge, Susan N. Wooldridge, John N. Wooldridge, George T. Wooldridge, William H. Wooldridge, Elizabeth M. Wooldridge, Josiah Wooldridge, and Mary A. Wooldridge. Hotelkeeper in Hickman, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Hickman in 1850. Farmer in Moscow in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, Hickman, p. 113A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 917.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Moscow, p. 456.
"William Ferdinand Wooldridge (1811-1879)," Find A Grave, Memorial #80756185, accessed September 15, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/80756185.
